content.description: A particle diagram for a chemical reaction is shown.
content.question: Which of the following chemical changes is best represented by the particle diagram shown? (Water molecules are omitted for clarity.)

choices.label: <math alttext="2 A g N O 3, aqueous, plus M g I 2, aqueous, react to produce 2 A g I, solid, plus M g, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mn>3</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>MgI</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>AgI</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>Mg</mi><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="A g N O 3, aqueous, plus K C l, aqueous, react to produce A g C l, solid, plus K N O 3, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>KCl</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>KNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 H C l, aqueous, plus B a, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2 aqueous, react to produce B a C l 2, solid, plus 2 H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ba</mtext><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>OH</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>Ba</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="M n S O 4, aqueous, plus K 2 S, aqueous, react to produce M n S, aqueous, plus K 2 S O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>S</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mtext>MnS</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 A g N O 3, aqueous, plus M g I 2, aqueous, react to produce 2 A g I, solid, plus M g, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mn>3</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>MgI</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>AgI</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>Mg</mi><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
